meanings.definition: To complain in a feeble or petulant way
meanings.sent1: Stop your constant whining and try to find a solution.
meanings.sent2: She tends to whine whenever things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed to whine about the rain ruining his playtime.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine started to whine like a tired child.
meanings.sent5: Her whining voice echoed through the room, irritating everyone.
meanings.sent6: After a long day, all he did was whine about his sore feet.
meanings.sent7: I can't stand it when you whine about every little thing.
meanings.sent8: The child's constant whining made the teacher's patience wear thin.

meanings.definition: A long, high-pitched complaining cry or sound
meanings.sent1: The cat let out a loud whine when it got stuck in the tree.
meanings.sent2: The whine of the wind outside kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent3: The whine of the vacuum cleaner made the dog hide under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The whine of the teapot signaled that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent5: The baby's whine for attention could be heard from the next room.
meanings.sent6: I heard a distant whine that sounded like a lost puppy.
meanings.sent7: The whine of the car engine indicated it needed maintenance.
meanings.sent8: The high-pitched whine of the mosquito was driving me crazy.
